comment.author: 36401094@N08
comment._content: This is actually the frame of a traditional "Round Hall" as built by the Crow's, used for ceremonial gatherings. Teepee's and canvas tents are seen in the background.

comment.author: 61498590@N03
comment._content: Thanks so much for pointing this out to us. We've looked into this, and reviewed material available online in the Digital Collections of the American Heritage Center at the University of Wyoming. It appears as though this structure is known as a Sundance Lodge.
